channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Fitbit founders launch AI platform to help families monitor their health
item.description: Luffu uses AI in the background to gather and organize family information, learn day-to-day patterns, and flag notable changes so families can stay aligned and address potential wellbeing issues.

item.title: Soldes PC portables : voici l’ultime sélection des meilleures promotions sur les laptops bureautiques et gaming
item.description: Configuration gaming, bureautique, avec carte graphique Nvidia ou non, processeur AMD, Intel ou Qualcomm, écran IPS ou OLED... Nombre de PC portables sont en promotion lors de la dernière démarque des soldes d'hiver mais seuls quelques-uns méritent vraiment de figurer dans cette sélection.

item.title: Apple’s tiny but mighty iPad Mini is $100 off in every storage configuration
item.description: If your phone feels too small but most tablets feel too big, Apple’s latest iPad Mini functions as a nice in-between. Thankfully, if you’ve been waiting for a discount, the base model with Wi-Fi and 128GB of storage is on sale at Amazon and Best Buy for $399 ($100 off), which is $50 shy of […]

item.title: Alerte Play Store : le malware Anatsa a piraté 50 000 smartphones Android, désinstallez vite cette app
item.description: Un faux « lecteur de documents » a été débusqué sur le Play Store. Cette application cache le cheval de Troie bancaire Anatsa, taillé pour siphonner l'argent de votre compte.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra : design, écran, fenêtre de sortie, prix… Tout ce qu’on sait sur le futur smartphone
item.description: Le Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra approche petit à petit, voici tout ce que l'on sait déjà à son sujet (fenêtre de sortie, design, écran, performances, etc.).

item.title: Le Nothing Phone (3a) et son design transparent si particulier déjà avec 40 % de remise
item.description: Entre son design transparent et son système de glyph, le Nothing Phone (3a) saura vous surprendre. Pour vous attirer encore plus, AliExpress retire presque 40 % de son prix de base et le fait tomber à seulement 214,46 euros avec un code promo.

item.title: Abonnés Crunchyroll, il y a une mauvaise nouvelle pour vous
item.description: La plateforme de streaming d'animation Crunchyroll démarre l'année 2026 avec un changement dont les utilisateurs se seraient bien passés.

item.title: L’empire de Musk vaut maintenant 1 250 milliards… mais repose sur une faille majeure
item.description: Dans une nouvelle opération commerciale, Elon Musk a réuni X et xAI dans un seul groupe, le tout, désormais sous la coupe de SpaceX. Ce qui en fait aujourd'hui l'entreprise non cotée en Bourse la plus chère du monde. Mais pourquoi tout ce fracas ?

item.title: Pourquoi la Chine dit non aux poignées de portes électriques des voitures
item.description: Pourtant très populaires sur les voitures électriques, la Chine vient d’acter l’interdiction des poignées de porte uniquement électriques. Une démarche visant à accroître la sécurité à bord des véhicules, mais qui ne devrait pas plaire à tout le monde !

item.title: YouTube siffle la fin de la récré pour ceux qui ne veulent pas payer la lecture en arrière-plan
item.description: YouTube serait peut-être en train de désactiver la lecture en arrière-plan sur plusieurs navigateurs mobiles tiers, une fonction prisée pour ne pas avoir à payer d'abonnement Premium.

item.title: The year of the AI agents? More outages? Here’s what lies ahead for IT teams in 2026
item.description: In 2026, AI agents, chaos engineering, and multi-cloud strategies will redefine IT resilience and risk management.

item.title: Ce n’est pas une panne, Ubisoft a coupé ses serveurs
item.description: Ubisoft procède à une maintenance à la fois inattendue et d'envergure. L'éditeur français a coupé ses serveurs pendant plusieurs heures.

item.title: Quelle est la voiture électrique avec la meilleure autonomie en 2026 ?
item.description: Découvrez notre comparatif des meilleures autonomies pour une voiture électrique. Des citadines, aux berlines en passant par les SUV, voici une sélection des voitures électriques à la meilleure autonomie sur la route.

item.title: Crise du smartphone en 2026 ? Pas pour Google qui pourrait rafler la mise avec ses Pixel
item.description: Le marché du mobile tire la langue, asphyxié par le coût des composants et une demande mondiale en berne. Pourtant, au milieu de la tempête, un acteur que l'on n'attendait pas forcément à ce niveau semble avoir trouvé la formule magique : Google. Les prévisions pour 2026 sont excellentes pour la gamme Pixel, et on vous explique pourquoi.

item.title: Notepad++ says it was hijacked by Chinese state-sponsored hackers
item.description: Last year, the creator of Notepad++ rolled out an update for the text and source code editor after security experts reported that bad actors were hijacking its update mechanism to redirect traffic to malicious servers. It led to users downloading compromised executables that could infect their devices. Now, Don Ho has revealed that multiple security experts investigated the breach and determined that the threat actor “is likely a Chinese state-sponsored group.” He said it explained why experts observed highly selective targeting during the campaign and why only traffic from certain users were ...

item.title: Moltbook, le réseau social où les IA discutent entre elles, inquiète de plus en plus
item.description: La plateforme Moltbook est sur toutes les lèvres depuis sa création. Une semaine plus tard, des voix s'élèvent pour alerter sur ses dérives potentielles.

item.title: Millions of books died so Claude could live
item.description: When ChatGPT launched, in November of 2022, it started a race that almost immediately consumed the tech industry. OpenAI didn't invent the concept of AI, but most of the state-of-the-art technology was confined to research labs at companies and institutions around the world. Then, suddenly, it was everywhere. And better than anyone expected. So many […]...

item.title: AI as the key to overcoming retail’s next challenge: achieving operational excellence
item.description: How achieving operational brilliance can be achieved with AI to bridge the gap between the issue many retailers face - limited resources and staffing.

item.title: Spain set to ban social media for children under 16
item.description: Spain will join the growing list of countries banning access to social media for children, Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez announced Tuesday. The law will apply to users under 16 years of age amidst a broader push to hold social media companies accountable for hate speech, social division and illegal content. Speaking at the World Governments Summit in Dubai, Prime Minister Sanchez excoriated social media, calling it a "failed state" where "laws are ignored and crime is endured." He spoke to the importance of digital governance for these platforms, highlighting recent incidents like X's AI chatbo...

item.title: Trump Admin Sued For Defunding the “Most Important Infrastructure Project in the Country”
item.description: The project would improve the most heavily traveled portion of the national passenger rail system.

item.title: La Switch est la console la plus vendue de l’histoire de Nintendo, devant la DS
item.description: Malgré le lancement de la Switch 2 en juin dernier, Nintendo continue de tirer tout le jus restant des bonnes vieilles Switch de première génération (il en reste !). Des modèles qui continuent de se vendre… et qui représentent désormais la gamme la plus vendue du constructeur, devant la vénérable DS.

item.title: Amazon's Echo Show 8 and 11 are down to new all-time lows
item.description: Amazon is running a sale on two of its newest devices. First, there's the Echo Show 8, which is down to $150 from $180 — a 17 percent discount. Next up is the Echo Show 11, which is more or less the same device, just bigger. This model has dropped 18 percent to $180 from $220. Both deals bring the Echo Shows down to new all-time low prices. The Echo Show 8 and 11 came out in mid-November with the main difference being screen size. The Echo Show 8 has an 8.7-inch HD screen that Amazon claims is 15 percent larger than its predecessor. Meanwhile, the Echo Show 11 is, you guessed it, an 11-inch F...

item.title: China is banning hidden electric door handles for EVs
item.description: China is banning Tesla-style concealed door handles on electric vehicles to address safety concerns regarding people getting trapped inside their cars. The ban will take effect on January 1st next year, according to the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology's announcement, and will require all vehicles sold in China to have mechanical release door handles […]...

item.title: How these MAHA activists are forming an unlikely alliance with Lee Zeldin’s EPA
item.description: With an eye on the midterms, Lee Zeldin’s EPA has been giving MAHA activists a seat at the table. On New Year’s Eve, Lee Zeldin did something out of character for an Environmental Protection Agency leader who has been hacking away at regulations intended to protect Americans’ air and water.He announced new restrictions on five chemicals commonly used in building materials, plastic products and adhesives, and he cheered it as a “MAHA win.”It was one of many signs of a fragile collaboration that’s been building between a Republican administration that’s traditionally supported big business and a...

item.description: NordVPN’s latest no-logs audit once again validates the company’s long-standing privacy claim: it doesn’t retain any identifying logs of its users. Here's why it matters.

Described as an "intelligent family care system," Luffu collects and logs health and medical information from connected devices, other platforms like Apple Health and Fitbit, and details shared by family members through voice […]...

item.title: Humans are infiltrating the social network for AI bots
item.description: Ordinary social networks face a constant onslaught of chatbots pretending to be human. A new social platform for AI agents may face the opposite problem: getting clogged up by humans pretending to post as bots. Moltbook - a website meant for conversations between agents from the platform OpenClaw - went viral this weekend for its […]

item.title: OpenClaw is a major leap forward for AI—and a cybersecurity nightmare
item.description: Security researchers say thousands of exposed OpenClaw gateways could let hackers read private files, emails, and messages. Cybersecurity researchers have discovered roughly 1,000 unprotected gateways to OpenClaw, an open-source and proactive AI agent that can be controlled through text conversations with apps like WhatsApp or Telegram. The gateways were found on the open internet, allowing anyone to access users’ personal information. One white hat hacker also reportedly gamed OpenClaw’s skills system, which lets users add plugins for tasks like web automation or system control, to reach the ...

item.title: Disney says Josh D’Amaro will replace Bob Iger as CEO
item.description: Disney has picked a successor for longtime CEO Bob Iger. On Tuesday, the entertainment giant announced that its theme parks head, Josh D'Amaro, will take over as CEO on March 18th, 2026. Rumors about Iger's replacement have been swirling for more than a year now. After a 15-year-long tenure as Disney's CEO, Iger returned from […]

item.title: Mario Tennis Fever preview: A racket-smashing blast
item.description: New Mario sports games typically only come around once in a generation. So to get a fresh installment of tennis featuring a deep roster of characters this early in the Switch 2's lifecycle is rather exciting. And after getting a chance to play Mario Tennis Fever prior to its official release on February 12, the best entry to the franchise yet might only be a couple of weeks away. Once again, Mario Tennis Fever relies on the series' familiar mix of topspin, slice and flat (power) shots used in previous games. The big new mechanic for this title is that instead of Zone Shots from Mario Tennis Ac...

item.title: The Switch 2's Virtual Boy is a tribute to Nintendo's wackiest console
item.description: Even in 2026, VR still feels like tech that isn't quite ready for prime time. When Nintendo released the original Virtual Boy way back in 1995, it was hard for my 10-year-old brain to comprehend a 3D console with a bipod, a facemask and a monochrome red display. Then, when you factor in weak sales that led to the system being discontinued after only a year, you end up with a gadget that felt more like a mythical creature than something you could actually buy. But that's changing later this month when the Virtual Boy returns as an add-on for the Switch 2. After getting an early demo of Nintendo...

item.title: NASA moves Artemis 2 launch to March after hydrogen leak during testing
item.description: NASA started making the final preparations for the Artemis 2 mission in early January, with the hopes of opening its launch window as soon as February 6. After issues showed up during the mission’s wet dress rehearsal in the early hours of February 3, however, the agency had to push back its earliest launch opportunity to March. “With more than three years between SLS launches, we fully anticipated encountering challenges. That is precisely why we conduct a wet dress rehearsal. These tests are designed to surface issues before flight and set up launch day with the highest probability of succes...

item.title: This ‘chemical sponge’ sucks up the valuable minerals in polluted water
item.description: Supra, a UT Austin spinout, makes 3D printed cartridges that could help build a new supply chain for rare earth elements in the U.S.—and clean up the environment. So-called rare earth elements aren’t actually rare. It’s just difficult to refine them into the purified forms that are needed for making things like electronics or clean energy tech. The standard processes are also toxic, which is one reason that the world has outsourced production to China....

item.title: Bad Bunny and the threat of ICE: The 2026 Super Bowl comes at a flashpoint in U.S. politics
item.description: As the DHS threatens to send ICE agents to the game, over 184,000 people have signed a petition in protest. Don’t tune into the Super Bowl hoping for a break from the tumultuous politics gripping the U.S.The NFL is facing pressure ahead of Sunday’s game between the Seattle Seahawks and the New England Patriots to take a more explicit stance against the Trump administration’s aggressive immigration enforcement. More than 184,000 people have signed a petition calling on the league to denounce the potential presence of Immigration and Customs Enforcement at the Super Bowl, which is being held at ...
